abstract: <jats:p>It describes Nyctobrya ingridae Falck, sp. nov. and record N. canaria (Alphéraky, 1890) for the first time from the Canary Island, El Hierro, Spain. Photographs of adults and genitalia of the new species are provided. Both species are DNA barcoded. Both morphology and analyses of DNA barcodes support the identification and distinctiveness of the new species as it appears well-supported and genetically isolated.</jats:p>
title: Further knowledge of the genus Nyctobrya Boursin, 1957 from the Canary Islands (Spain), with description of a new species from El Hierro (Lepidoptera: Noctuidae)

reference.unstructured: Behounek, G., & Speidel, W. (2013). Contribution to the knowledge of the genus Nyctobrya BOURSIN, 1957 (Lepidoptera: Noctuidae: Bryophilinae) in the Macaronesian archipelago, with description of a new species from Gran Canaria. Zeitschrift der Arbeitsgemeinschaft Österreichischer Entomologen, Wien, 65, 157-166.

Falck, P., & Karsholt, O. (2022). New data on Noctuoidea from the Canary Islands, Spain (Lepidoptera: Noctuoidea). SHILAP Revista de lepidopterología, 50(197), 145-165. https://doi.org/10.57065/shilap.201

Fischer, H., & de Freina, J. J. (2014). Nyctobrya hierroana sp. n., eine weitere Art der makaronesischen Nyctobrya simonyi (Rogenhofer, 1889)-Artengruppe (Lepidoptera: Noctuidae: Bryophilinae). Mitteilungen der Münchner Entomologischen Gesellschaft, 104, 139-143.

Hebert, P. D. N., Cywinska, A., Ball, S. L., & Deward, J. R. (2003). Biological identifications through DNA barcodes. Proceedings of the Royal Society of London Series B: Biololgical Sciences, 270, 313-321. https://doi.org/10.1098/rspb.2002.2218
